Methods

GetXmlEnumAttributeOrName<T>(T)

Gets the XML enum name for the specified Enum value if defined by an XmlEnumAttribute, otherwise returns the enum's standard name.

public static string GetXmlEnumAttributeOrName<T>(this T enumValue) where T : struct, IConvertible

Parameters

enumValue T

The enumeration value.

Returns

string

A string containing either the XmlEnumAttribute name of the specified T value or the enum’s default name if no attribute is present.

Type Parameters

T

An enumeration type.

Remarks

This method determines whether the provided enumeration value is decorated with an XmlEnumAttribute. If so, it returns the attribute’s name; otherwise, it returns the enum’s intrinsic name.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if the provided value is not an Enum.

GetXmlEnumAttribute<T>(T)

Gets the XML enum name defined by the XmlEnumAttribute that decorates the specified Enum value. If the attribute is not present, an exception is thrown.

public static string GetXmlEnumAttribute<T>(this T enumValue) where T : struct, IConvertible

Parameters

enumValue T

The enumeration value.

Returns

string

The name specified in the XmlEnumAttribute for the given enumValue.

Type Parameters

T

An enumeration type.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if T is not an enumeration type.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the XmlEnumAttribute is missing for the specified enumeration value.
